node.title: Fewer Americans Support Mask, Vaccine Mandates Ahead of Holiday Gatherings, Poll Finds
node.description: Six in 10 Americans say they feel worn out by pandemic-related changes they've had to make to their daily lives.

node.title: All Weather Records Broken in 2021: Temperatures, Rain and Snowfall
node.description: Earlier this week, Los Angeles had a record amount of rainfall, with 2.16 inches of rain, breaking a previous record set in 1888.

node.title: Chicago Woman Who Was Handcuffed Naked Receives $2.9 Million Settlement
node.description: The Chicago City Council approved a settlement on Wednesday for Anjanette Young, a medical social worker who was forced to stand naked in front of a dozen police officers in 2019.

node.title: Here’s what’s behind Britain’s dire estimate of 200,000 new Omicron cases in a day.
node.description: Experts called it ‘a back-of-the-envelope calculation’ that showed how quickly the variant spreads, but also how little is known about it.

node.title: German Police Say 6 Investigated for Threatening to Kill Lawmakers Over COVID Restrictions
node.description: German police raided six locations Wednesday in an investigation into online death threats by far-right groups against several Saxony government officials.

node.title: Former Disney Performer Says Characters Are Only Allowed to Speak English in Viral Video
node.description: The TikToker says that while there are some exceptions now, when she worked at the park the rule was made very clear.

node.title: 'It's a lost art': Local bakeries struggle to find key ingredient — trained, enthusiastic staff
node.description: First it was the butchers, now it could be the bakers. As traditional bakeries face a skilled-worker shortage, the industry calls for schools and governments to do more to encourage apprenticeships across Australia.

node.title: All the COVID news you need from across Australia
node.description: Get up to speed with all of the coronavirus news from across Australia with our COVID blog. Follow live.

node.title: More women sue Tesla over alleged sexual harassment
node.description: The lawyer for the six women suing Tesla for alleged sexual harassment says more women are coming forward with allegations of harassment suffered while employed at the electric car company.

node.title: New Zealand's balance of payment deficits reach record high
node.description: The country has reached its largest ever balance of payments deficit since records began in the 1970s, due to ongoing import growth.

node.title: Abuse survivors says devil will be in the detail when it comes to redress
node.description: People abused while in care are welcoming recommendations for the establishment of an independent redress system for survivors, but say the devil will be in the detail.

node.title: Hospitals across the country in line for upgrades to treat Covid-19 patients
node.description: From Kaitaia to Invercargill, 24 local hospitals will receive upgrades to better manage Covid-19 patients in their own wing or in negative pressure rooms. Audio

node.title: How Benton Harbor residents are living with lead water crisis
node.description: Health officials have urged residents to use bottled water for tasks like cooking, drinking and brushing teeth. Officials say there's been a high lead presence in the city's water since 2018.

node.title: Logic's "1-800-273-8255" song may have saved hundreds of lives, study finds
node.description: "I just wanted them to know that they really weren't alone," the rapper told "CBS Sunday Morning" about the song in 2017.

node.title: How to Soften the Bullwhip Effect
node.description: Overordering has created shortages and pushed up inflation.

node.title: When the Show Doesn’t Go On: Broadway Is Rattled by Covid Cancellations
node.description: Broadway, where cancellations were once vanishingly rare, has seen a raft of them as positive coronavirus tests among cast and crew members have upended productions.

node.title: Libertarian Group Campaigning to Cut $20M in Funding for Idaho Universities
node.description: Idaho Republicans and Libertarians are calling for more cuts next year to public education spending to stop the public schools from "indoctrinating" students.

node.title: Metropolitan Opera Requiring Audience Members to Have COVID Booster to Attend Performances
node.description: "With the news of the rapid spread of the Omicron COVID-19 variant, ...we must now take additional steps to protect our community," the Met said in an email.

node.title: 'I Would Have Quit': Family's Viral TikTok Ice Cream Order Song Divides Internet
node.description: "Wow I totally understand the guy from the store was completely blown away," one commenter said of the creative order.

node.title: Meet Hitler's beetle — the species going extinct because of its name
node.description: One of Australia's largest groups of flower species is named after a wealthy British slave-trader. And Nazi memorabilia collectors have almost sent "Hitler's beetle" extinct. Is it time for a change, asks Kevin Thiele.

node.title: We calculated the impact of 'long COVID' as Australia opens up. Even without Omicron, we're worried
node.description: Long COVID will increasingly drive the burden of COVID illness, even as death rates decline. We looked at how that will affect Australia as we open up, write Martin Hensher and Mary Rose Angeles.

node.title: Police say unvaxxed Queenslanders won't 'grandstand' over bans, but venue owners say tensions are rising
node.description: The police union says extra officers will not be needed to enforce rules banning unvaxxed people from hospitality venues, because most "are keen to do the right thing".

node.title: The mouse plague started with a perfect storm — now it looks like it's ending in one
node.description: La Niña has been wreaking havoc in NSW, but it – and the wet weather that preceded it – have at least helped to solve one problem.

node.title: 'It was terrifying': Two days after her operation, Sam was on her way back to hospital, screaming in extreme pain
node.description: Canberra gynaecologist Omar Adham has been cautioned by the medical regulator about obtaining informed consent from a patient before an operation, as it investigates complaints from seven of Dr Adham's former patients.

node.title: Michigan State names Tate Myre as honorary football recruit
node.description: "Tate is and always will be a Spartan Dawg," head coach Mel Tucker said Wednesday

node.title: Business Groups Sue Over California Law They Say Could Keep Pork Off Plates
node.description: A 2018 ballot initiative creating minimum space requirements for livestock is set to go into effect on Jan. 1. Food industry interests are warning of possible shortages and price increases.

node.title: Antony Blinken's Tour of SE Asia Cut Short After Journalist Tests Positive for COVID
node.description: The secretary of state had to suddenly leave Thailand, the last stop on his Southeast Asia trip, after the coronavirus test.

node.title: Free School Lunch Expands to 8 More U.S. States, Now Reaching About 75 Percent of Students
node.description: Students that have Medicaid will also now be automatically added to the program and be able to receive free or reduced-price meals for lunch and breakfast.

node.title: Suspect Said He Was Going Back to Jail, Shot Phoenix Cop Multiple Times: Police
node.description: Essa Kolareh Eugene Williams faces charges including attempted first-degree murder stemming from an incident that left a police officer in critical condition.

node.title: Teen Charged With Homicide After Using Father's Gun to Shoot 5-Year-Old Brother: Police
node.description: The 13-year-old boy was reportedly angry that his brother wouldn't stop jumping on the bed.
